Material used.Description: The experiments were conducted using HEK293 cells transiently transfected with wild-type and mutant SNCA constructs.

Readout description.Result Description: Increased α-synuclein aggregation and phosphorylation in cells expressing c.100G>A (p.G34S) compared to wild-type.
Enhanced membrane binding and reduced solubility in cells expressing c.100G>C (p.G34R) compared to wild-type.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent biological replicates were performed for each condition.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type SNCA construct was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Unpaired Student's t-test was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: α-synuclein phosphorylation levels < 20% of wild-type control.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: α-synuclein phosphorylation levels ≥ 50% of wild-type control.

Material used.Description: Immunohistochemistry was performed on brain tissue from transgenic mice expressing SNCA variants.

Readout description.Result Description: Neuronal loss and Lewy body-like inclusions observed in mice expressing c.100G>A (p.G34S).
Dopaminergic neuron degeneration and increased glial activation in mice expressing c.100G>C (p.G34R).

Biological replicates.Description: Five mice per group were analyzed.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type mice were used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Non-transgenic littermates were used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA followed by post-hoc Tukey's test was used.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: No Lewy body-like inclusions and normal neuronal density.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Presence of Lewy body-like inclusions and ≥ 30% neuronal loss.
